RecommendedActions.Description: Use other Stream types.  Most stream implementations in .Net framework already buffer their content, which is preferable to wrapping in a buffered stream.
Use Dispose() instead.
Use other Stream types.  Most stream implementations in .Net framework already buffer their content, which is preferable to wrapping in a buffered stream.
Use File.GetLastWriteTime().ToUniversalTime().

Use File.Open to get a Stream then pass it to StreamWriter constructor.
Use File.GetAttributes(), check (fileInfo.Attributes & FileAttributes.ReadOnly) == FileAttributes.ReadOnly.
Use fileInfo.Attributes = fileInfo.Attributes | FileAttributes.ReadOnly to set read-only and fileInfo.Attributes = fileInfo.Attributes & ~FileAttributes.ReadOnly to clear it.
